cards.name: Alakazam

abilities.name: Damage Swap
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to another as long as you don't Knock Out that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Alakazam is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

cards.text: Its brain can outperform a supercomputer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5000.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Blastoise

abilities.name: Rain Dance
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach 1 Water Energy card to 1 of your Water Pokémon. (This doesn't use up your 1 Energy card attachment for the turn.) This power can't be used if Blastoise is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

cards.text: A brutal Pokémon with pressurized water jets on its shell. They are used for high-speed tackles.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Blastoise but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

cards.name: Chansey
cards.text: A rare and elusive Pokémon that is said to bring happiness to those who manage to catch it.

attacks.name: Scrunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Chansey during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Chansey does 80 damage to itself.

cards.name: Charizard

abilities.name: Energy Burn
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may turn all Energy attached to Charizard into Fire Energy for the rest of the turn. This power can't be used if Charizard is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

cards.text: Spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to unintentionally cause forest fires.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy cards attached to Charizard in order to use this attack.

cards.name: Clefable
cards.text: A timid Fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen. It will run and hide the moment it senses people.

attacks.name: Metronome
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy costs and anything else required in order to use that attack, such as discarding Energy cards. (No matter what type the Defending Pokémon is, Clefable's type is still Colorless.)

attacks.name: Minimize
attacks.text: All damage done by attacks to Clefable during your opponent's next turn is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Clefairy
cards.text: Its magical and cute appeal has many admirers. It is rare and found only in certain areas.

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Metronome
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy costs and anything else required in order to use that attack, such as discarding Energy cards. (No matter what type the Defending Pokémon is, Clefairy's type is still Colorless.)

cards.name: Gyarados
cards.text: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.

attacks.name: Bubblebeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Hitmonchan
cards.text: While seeming to do nothing, it fires punches in lightning-fast volleys that are impossible to see.

cards.name: Magneton
cards.text: Formed by several Magnemites linked together. It frequently appears when sunspots flare up.

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Magneton does 80 damage to itself.

cards.name: Mewtwo
cards.text: A scientist created this Pokémon after years of horrific gene-splicing and DNA engineering experiments.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Barrier
attacks.text: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Mewtwo in order to use this attack. During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Mewtwo.

cards.name: Nidoking
cards.text: Uses its powerful tail in battle to smash, constrict, then break its prey's bones.

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage and Nidoking does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Toxic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. It now takes 20 Poison damage instead of 10 after each player's turn (even if it was already Poisoned).

cards.name: Nidoqueen
cards.text: Its hard scales provide strong protection. It uses its hefty bulk to execute powerful moves.

attacks.name: Boyfriends
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each Nidoking you have in play.

cards.name: Ninetales
cards.text: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1,000-year curse.

attacks.name: Lure
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Ninetales in order to use this attack.

cards.name: Pidgeot
cards.text: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as Magikarp.

attacks.name: Hurricane
attacks.text: Unless this attack Knocks Out the Defending Pokémon, return the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your opponent's hand.

cards.name: Poliwrath
cards.text: An adept swimmer at both the front crawl and breaststroke. Easily overtakes the best human swimmers.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Poliwrath but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Whirlpool
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

cards.name: Raichu
cards.text: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high-voltage power.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Raichu.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Raichu does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Scyther
cards.text: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one of it.

attacks.name: Swords Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, Scyther's Slash attack's base damage is 60 instead of 30.

cards.name: Venusaur

abilities.name: Energy Trans
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may take 1 Grass Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon and attach it to a different one. This power can't be used if Venusaur is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

cards.text: This plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

cards.name: Wigglytuff
cards.text: The body is soft and rubbery. When angered, it will suck in air and inflate itself to an enormous size.

attacks.name: Lullaby
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Do the Wave
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Zapdos
cards.text: A legendary bird Pokémon said to appear from clouds while wielding enormous lightning bolts.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Zapdos does 30 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Zapdos in order to use this attack.

cards.name: Beedrill
cards.text: Flies at high speed and attacks using the large, venomous stingers on its forelegs and tail.

attacks.name: Twineedle
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Dragonair
cards.text: A mystical Pokémon that exudes a gentle aura. Has the ability to change climate conditions.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

cards.name: Dugtrio
cards.text: A team of Diglett triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Electabuzz
cards.text: Normally found near power plants, it can wander away and cause major blackouts in cities.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Thunderpunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage and Electabuzz does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Electrode

abilities.name: Buzzap
abilities.text: At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may Knock Out Electrode and attach it to 1 of your other Pokémon. If you do, choose a type of Energy. Electrode is now an Energy card of that type (instead of a Pokémon) that provides 2 energy. This power can't be used if Electrode is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

cards.text: It stores electrical energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.

attacks.name: Electric Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Electrode does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Kangaskhan
cards.text: The infant rarely ventures out of its mother's protective pouch until it is three years old.

attacks.name: Fetch
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Comet Punch
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Mr. Mime

abilities.name: Invisible Wall
abilities.text: Whenever an attack (including your own) does 30 or more damage to Mr. Mime (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.) This power stops working while Mr. Mime is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

cards.text: If interrupted while miming, it will slap around the enemy with its broad hands.

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Pidgeotto
cards.text: Very protective of its sprawling territory, this Pokémon will fiercely peck at any intruder.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mirror Move
attacks.text: If Pidgeotto was attacked last turn, do the final result of that attack on Pidgeotto to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Pinsir
cards.text: If it fails to crush the victim in its pincers, it will swing its victim around and toss it hard.

attacks.name: Irongrip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Snorlax

abilities.name: Thick Skinned
abilities.text: Snorlax can't become Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. This power can't be used if Snorlax is already Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

cards.text: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Venomoth

abilities.name: Shift
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may change the type of Venomoth to the type of any other Pokémon in play other than Colorless. This power can't be used if Venomoth is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

cards.text: The dust-like scales covering its wings are color coded to indicate the kinds of poison it has.

attacks.name: Venom Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

cards.name: Victreebel
cards.text: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.

attacks.name: Lure
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Acid
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your next turn.

cards.name: Arcanine
cards.text: A Pokémon that has been long admired for its beauty. It runs gracefully, as if on wings.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Arcanine in order to use this attack.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Arcanine does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Butterfree
cards.text: In battle, it flaps its wings at high speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Butterfree equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Butterfree has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

cards.name: Charmeleon
cards.text: When it swings its burning tail, it raises the temperature to unbearably high levels.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Charmeleon in order to use this attack.

cards.name: Dewgong
cards.text: Stores thermal energy in its body. Swims at a steady 8 knots even in intensely cold waters.

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Dodrio

abilities.name: Retreat Aid
abilities.text: As long as Dodrio is Benched, pay Colorless less to retreat your Active Pokémon.

cards.text: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head stays awake.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Dodrio.

cards.name: Dratini
cards.text: Long considered a mythical Pokémon until recently, when a small colony was found living underwater.

cards.name: Exeggutor
cards.text: Legend has it that on rare occasions, one of its heads will drop off and continue on as an Exeggcute.

attacks.name: Teleport
attacks.text: Switch Exeggutor with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Big Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy attached to Exeggutor. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Farfetch'd
cards.text: The sprig of green onions it holds is its weapon. This sprig is used much like a metal sword.

attacks.name: Leek Slap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. Either way, you can't use this attack again as long as Farfetch'd stays in play (even putting Farfetch'd on the Bench won't let you use it again).

cards.name: Fearow
cards.text: With its huge and magnificent wings, it can keep aloft without ever having to land for rest.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Fearow.

cards.name: Growlithe
cards.text: Very protective of its territory. It will bark and bite to repel intruders from its space.

cards.name: Haunter
cards.text: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Dream Eater
attacks.text: You can't use this attack unless the Defending Pokémon is Asleep.

cards.name: Ivysaur
cards.text: When the bulb on its back grows large, the Pokémon seems to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Jynx
cards.text: Merely by meditating, the Pokémon launches a powerful psychic energy attack.

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Kadabra
cards.text: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches even to those just nearby.

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Kadabra in order to use this attack. Remove all damage counters from Kadabra.

cards.name: Kakuna
cards.text: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokémon can only harden its shell to protect itself from predators.

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Kakuna during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Lickitung
cards.text: Its tongue can be extended like a chameleon's. It leaves a stinging sensation when it licks enemies.

attacks.name: Tongue Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Machoke
cards.text: Its muscular body is so powerful that it must wear a power-save belt to help regulate its motions.

attacks.name: Karate Chop
attacks.text: Does 50 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Machoke.

attacks.name: Submission
attacks.text: Machoke does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Magikarp
cards.text: In the distant past, it was stronger than its horribly weak descendants that exist today.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Magikarp.

cards.name: Magmar
cards.text: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly among flames.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Magmar in order to use this attack.

cards.name: Marowak
cards.text: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to K.O. targets.

attacks.name: Bonemerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Call for Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fighting Basic Pokémon card and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

cards.name: Nidorina
cards.text: The female's horn develops slowly. Prefers physical attacks such as clawing and biting.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Nidorino
cards.text: An aggressive Pokémon that is quick to attack. The horn on its head secretes a powerful venom.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Parasect
cards.text: A host-parasite pair in which the parasite mushroom has taken over the host bug. Prefers damp places.

attacks.name: Spore
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Persian
cards.text: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.

attacks.name: Pounce
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon attacks Persian during your next turn, any damage done by the attack is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

cards.name: Poliwhirl
cards.text: Capable of living in or out of water. When out of water, it sweats to keep its body slimy.

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Raticate
cards.text: It uses its whiskers to maintain its balance. It seems to slow down if they are cut off.

attacks.name: Super Fang
attacks.text: Does damage to the Defending Pokémon equal to half the Defending Pokémon's remaining HP (rounded up to the nearest 10).

cards.name: Rhydon
cards.text: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3600 degrees.

attacks.name: Ram
attacks.text: Rhydon does 20 damage to itself. If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon. Switch the Pokémon even if Rhydon is knocked out.)

cards.name: Seaking
cards.text: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming powerfully up rivers and creeks.

cards.name: Seel
cards.text: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. This horn is used for bashing through thick ice.

cards.name: Tauros
cards.text: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

attacks.name: Rampage
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Tauros. Flip a coin. If tails, Tauros is now Confused (after doing damage).

cards.name: Wartortle
cards.text: Often hides in water to stalk unweary prey. When swimming quickly, it moves its ears to maintain balance.

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Wartortle during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

cards.name: Weepinbell
cards.text: It spits out poisonpowder to immobilize the enemy, and then finishes the enemy with a spray of acid.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Abra
cards.text: Using its ability to read minds, it will identify impending danger and teleport to safety.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Bellsprout
cards.text: A carnivorous Pokémon that traps and eats bugs. It uses its root feet to soak up needed moisture.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon named Bellsprout and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

cards.name: Bulbasaur
cards.text: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. Thus, a plant sprouted and now grows with this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Unless all damage from this attack is prevented, you may remove 1 damage counter from Bulbasaur.

cards.name: Caterpie
cards.text: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Charmander
cards.text: Obviously prefers hot places. If it gets caught in the rain, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Charmander in order to use this attack.

cards.name: Cubone
cards.text: Because it never removes its skull helmet, no one has ever seen this Pokémon's real face.

attacks.name: Snivel
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon attacks Cubone during your opponent's next turn, any damage done by the attack is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Cubone.

cards.name: Diglett
cards.text: Lives about three feet underground, where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears above ground.

cards.name: Doduo
cards.text: A bird that makes up for its poor flying with its fast foot speed. Leaves giant footprints.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Drowzee
cards.text: Puts enemies to sleep, then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating bad dreams.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Exeggcute
cards.text: Often mistaken for eggs. When disturbed, they quickly gather and attack in swarms.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Unless all damage from this attack is prevented, you may remove 1 damage counter from Exeggcute.

cards.name: Gastly
cards.text: Almost invisible, this gaseous Pokémon cloaks the target and puts it to sleep without notice.

attacks.name: Sleeping Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Destiny Bond
attacks.text: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Gastly in order to use this attack. If a Pokémon Knocks Out Gastly during your opponent's next turn, Knock Out that Pokémon.

cards.name: Goldeen
cards.text: Its tail fin billows like an elegant ballroom dress, giving it the nickname "Water Queen."

cards.name: Jigglypuff
cards.text: When its huge eyes light up, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.

attacks.name: Lullaby
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Machop
cards.text: Loves to build its muscles. It trains in all styles of martial arts to become even stronger.

cards.name: Magnemite
cards.text: Uses anti-gravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses attacks like Thunder Wave.

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Magnemite does 40 damage to itself.

cards.name: Meowth
cards.text: Adores circular objects. Wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.

attacks.name: Pay Day
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, draw a card.

cards.name: Metapod
cards.text: It is vulnerable to attack because its shell is soft, exposing its weak and tender body.

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Metapod during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Nidoran ♀
cards.text: Although small, its venomous barbs make this Pokémon dangerous. The female has smaller horns.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon named Nidoran ♂ or Nidoran ♀ and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

cards.name: Nidoran ♂
cards.text: Stiffens its ears to sense danger. The larger, more powerful of its horns secretes venom.

attacks.name: Horn Hazard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Onix
cards.text: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to a diamond, though colored black.

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever 30 or less damage is done to Onix (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

cards.name: Paras
cards.text: Burrows to suck tree roots. The mushrooms on its back grow by drawing nutrients from the bug host.

attacks.name: Spore
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Pidgey
cards.text: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

cards.name: Pikachu
cards.text: When several of these Pokémon gather, their electricity can cause lightning storms.

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Pikachu does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Poliwag
cards.text: Its newly grown legs prevent it from running. It appears to prefer swimming over trying to stand.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Poliwag but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

cards.name: Rattata
cards.text: Bites anything when it attacks. Small and very quick, it is a common sight in many places.

cards.name: Rhyhorn
cards.text: Its massive bones are 1,000 times harder than human bones. It can easily knock a trailer flying.

attacks.name: Leer
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack Rhyhorn during your opponent's next turn. (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

cards.name: Sandshrew
cards.text: Burrows deep underground in arid locations far from water. It only emerges to hunt for food.

attacks.name: Sand-attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

cards.name: Spearow
cards.text: Eats bugs in grassy areas. It has to flap its short wings at high speeds to stay airborne.

attacks.name: Mirror Move
attacks.text: If Spearow was attacked last turn, do the final result of that attack on Spearow to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Squirtle
cards.text: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. It powerfully sprays foam from its mouth.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Squirtle during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of opponent's attacks still happen.)

cards.name: Starmie
cards.text: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value this core as a gem.

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard 1 Water Energy card attached to Starmie in order to use this attack. Remove all damage counters from Starmie.

attacks.name: Star Freeze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Staryu
cards.text: An enigmatic Pokémon that can effortlessly regenerate any appendage it loses in battle.

cards.name: Tangela
cards.text: Its whole body is swathed with wide vines that are similar to seaweed. These vines shake as it walks.

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Venonat
cards.text: Lives in the shadows of tall trees where it eats insects. It is attracted by light at night.

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Venonat equal to the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance). If Venonat has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

cards.name: Voltorb
cards.text: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, it has zapped many people.

cards.name: Vulpix
cards.text: At the time of birth, it has just one tail. Its tail splits from the tip as it grows older.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Weedle
cards.text: Often found in forests, eating leaves. It has a sharp, venomous stinger on its head.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Computer Search
cards.text: Discard 2 of the other cards from your hand in order to search your deck for any card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Imposter Professor Oak
cards.text: Your opponent shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck, then draws 7 cards.

cards.name: Item Finder
cards.text: Discard 2 of the other cards from your hand in order to put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.

cards.name: Lass
cards.text: You and your opponent show each other your hands, then shuffle all the Trainer cards from your hands into your decks.

cards.name: Pokémon Breeder
cards.text: Put a Stage 2 Evolution card from your hand on the matching Basic Pokémon. You can only play this card when you would be allowed to evolve that Pokémon anyway.

cards.name: Pokémon Trader
cards.text: Trade 1 of the Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards in your hand for 1 of the Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards from your deck. Show both cards to your opponent. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Scoop Up
cards.text: Choose 1 of your Pokémon in play and return its Basic Pokémon card to your hand. (Discard all cards attached to that card.)

cards.name: Super Energy Removal
cards.text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your own Pokémon in order to choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and up to 2 Energy cards attached to it. Discard those Energy cards.

cards.name: Defender
cards.text: Attach Defender to 1 of your Pokémon. At the end of your opponent's next turn, discard Defender. Damage done to that Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Energy Retrieval
cards.text: Trade 1 of the other cards in your hand for up to 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile.

cards.name: Full Heal
cards.text: Your Active Pokémon is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned.

cards.name: Maintenance
cards.text: Shuffle 2 of the other cards from your hand into your deck in order to draw a card.

cards.name: PlusPower
cards.text: Attach PlusPower to your Active Pokémon. At the end of your turn, discard PlusPower. If this Pokémon's attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), the attack does 10 more damage to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Pokémon Center
cards.text: Remove all damage counters from all of your own Pokémon with damage counters on them, then discard all Energy cards attached to those Pokémon.

cards.name: Pokédex
cards.text: Look at up to 5 cards from the top of your deck and rearrange them as you like.

cards.name: Professor Oak
cards.text: Discard your hand, then draw 7 cards.

cards.name: Super Potion
cards.text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your own Pokémon in order to remove up to 4 damage counters from that Pokémon.

cards.name: Bill
cards.text: Draw 2 cards.

cards.name: Energy Removal
cards.text: Choose 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and discard it.

cards.name: Gust of Wind
cards.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with his or her Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Poké Ball
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, you may search your deck for any Basic Pokémon or Evolution card. Show that card to your opponent, then put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Potion
cards.text: Remove up to 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

cards.name: Switch
cards.text: Switch 1 of your Benched Pokémon with your Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Double Colorless Energy
cards.text: Provides Colorless Colorless energy. Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.
